intro: Fiebrigia, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their silver-gray foliage and showy yellow or white flower heads. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving them a distinctive appearance. Fiebrigia species are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive blooms and drought tolerance. They thrive in well-drained soil and full sun, making them suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
